column1: Yugorsk (Russian: Югорск) is a town in Khanty–Mansi Autonomous Okrug
column3: located in the northwestern part of the East-West lowland

column1: The relief in the town is flat. The town is surrounded by forests. The Ess River flows 5 kilometers (3.1 mi) from the town.
The settlement of Komsomolsky was built in 1962 to support timber and natural gas industries. The settlement grew as the gas fields of Western Siberia were being explored
column2: and the production association Tyumentransgas (since 2007 GazpromTransgazYugorsk) developed. In March 1959
column3: subdivisions of railway troops started the construction of the "Ivdel-Ob" railway.The town was renamed Yugorsk in July 1992. The name originates from the name of the land "Yugra"
column4: or "Yugoria"—the place where the Khanty and Mansi peoples live.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: it is incorporated as the town of okrug significance of Yugorsk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column3: the town of okrug significance of Yugorsk is incorporated as Yugorsk Urban Okrug.

column1: The OOO Gazprom transgaz Yugorsk gas company is based in Yugorsk.
